conclusion: Analyze the electric field and electric potential at the center of the equilateral triangle with charges at vertices.
Equal-magnitude like charges are placed at points A and B.
Electric field contributions from charges at A and B cancel each other out horizontally; net field is vertically upwards with magnitude E.
Potential at a point due to a charge is given by V = k*q/r.
Potential at O due to charges at A and B is the sum of potentials due to each charge.
An equal-magnitude opposite-sign charge is placed at point C.
Electric field due to charge at C is vertically downwards; net electric field at O is zero as fields cancel.
Potential at O due to charge at C is negative; net potential at O is zero as potentials cancel.
Magnitude of electric field strength at O is 0.
